post_text:
A huge Thank You to all the parents and students that participated in the Orientation the last three days. It was nice to see the interaction you had with the teachers.
I can ensure you that the Helix staff will try our best to provide as good of an education as is possible via distance learning. The staff at Helix appreciate your support and look forward to the day when all the students are back in our building. Thanks, Darrick Cope

post_text: I am so proud of the Helix Staff and all of the work they have put into making the 2020-21 school year successful and memorable for all of our students. If you are a Helix Grizzly, you should feel proud and special and know that the education that you are receiving at our small but mighty school is like none other!! Thank you teachers, parapros, parents and admin for all of your hardwork!! We are one big cog in this factory called education!! Here’s to another great school year in Helix!!!
text: I am so proud of the Helix Staff and all of the work they have put into making the 2020-21 school year successful and memorable for all of our students. If you are a Helix Grizzly, you should feel proud and special and know that the education that you are receiving at our small but mighty school is like none other!! Thank you teachers, parapros, parents and admin for all of your hardwork!! We are one big cog in this factory called education!! Here’s to another great school year in Helix!!!

post_text:
Face coverings required for K-12 students

As a result of Governor Brown’s recent proclamation, face coverings will be required for all students (K-12), and all staff, upon return to classes on August 31st. I will be amending the Operational Blueprint to include this requirement before submitting to ODE. I would hope that with time, we will return to face coverings for K-12 to be optional. Please feel free to contact me with your concerns. Thanks, Darrick Cope, Superintendent

For more information on this Governor Brown’s announcement, click on the link below:
http://www.osba.org/News-Center/Announcements/2020/20200722NewGuidance.aspx

As a result of the Pendleton Round-Up being cancelled, I will be recommending the school board approve a calendar change for the 2020/21 school year. Our current calendar has two half days and a no school day for Round-Up week. I will be requesting the board approve having full school days all week.
Thanks, Darrick Cope Superintendent
Helix School District

post_text:
InterMountain Technology is providing easy contact for Helpdesk support to families and students while schools are closed for online school work by calling 888-223-9593. The IT staff member answering the phone will create a Helpdesk ticket for the caller so that the district’s technician(s) can follow up to provide assistance. Technicians will do their best to support the caller remotely to assist the student with issues relating to classwork. Technicians will not be visiting people’s homes and may recommend contact with the family’s Internet provider for additional support if it’s determined that the issue is not related to district services or equipment.

The phone line will be answered during normal business hours, if the line is busy, unanswered or after hours (or during the weekend) the caller is encouraged to leave a voicemail with the following information:

*Student’s name(s)
*School district and attending school and grade level
*General description of the issue
*Call back phone number
*Email address for contact

In an attempt to have the least amount of impact on student learning, the Helix staff have generated links to supplemental materials for students in K-12. To access these materials, go to the Helix web page (https://www.helix.k12.or.us/), Helpful Links, Coronavirus Supplemental Assignments.
.
If students are having issues opening a Google Document, be sure they are logged into Google Acct or are in their Google Classroom before attempting to open. Feel free to email teachers with questions about the assignments, but only through Friday, March 20th.

Thanks, Mr. Cope

post_text:
As many of you know, the Joseph School District had a devastating fire in their gymnasium last week. Fire and water damaged a large portion of their elementary school, cafeteria, hallways and gym. The Helix School District will be holding a fundraiser during the Saturday, Jan. 25th basketball game against Powder Valley. As is always the case, admission to the game is free, but a cake raffle will be held and admission donations will be accepted. At the start of the girls’ and boys’ varsity games, we will be “Passing the Hat” to solicit additional donations. In addition, the Helix Booster Club has graciously agreed to match the total dollar amount raised at this event.

The Helix School District will present a check to Superintendent and girls’ basketball coach Lance Homan at the home basketball game against Joseph on Friday, January 31st. For more information, please contact the Helix School District office at (541) 457-2175.
text:

As is always the case, admission to the game is free, but a cake raffle will be held and admission donations will be accepted. At the start of the girls’ and boys’ varsity games, we will be “Passing the Hat” to solicit additional donations. In addition, the Helix Booster Club has graciously agreed to match the total dollar amount raised at this event.

The Helix School District will present a check to Superintendent and girls’ basketball coach Lance Homan at the home basketball game against Joseph on Friday, January 31st. For more information, please contact the Helix School District office at (541) 457-2175.

post_text: It is with deep regret and sorrow that I make this post. Long time teacher and volunteer, Elnora Baker passed away on Wednesday, Oct. 23rd at 5:30pm. We were blessed to have had her in our life and she will always be remembered for the wonderful person she was, the many hours she devoted to our school, and the lessons she taught us. Thoughts and prayers are with her family.

Thoughts and prayers are with her family.

post_text:
As part of the Student Success Act passed by the Oregon Legislature in 2019, schools are asking for student, parent and community input on what ways we can best serve our students. Informational fliers, like the one below, will be posted on social media and send home with students. A brief, two-question survey link will be sent to parents via text and posted on this Facebook page later in the week. For more information, please call the District Office.

https://www.oregon.gov/ode/StudentSuccess/Documents/SSA%20infographic%202019.pdf

post_text:
The Helix School District took the time this morning to remember the terrorist attack on Sept. 11, 2001. We all gathered at the flag pole and stood at attention as the flag was raised to half-mast. We played the Star Spangled banner and a few words were said about this day.



"The attacks of September 11th were intended to break our spirit. Instead we have emerged stronger and more unified. We feel renewed devotion to the principles of political, economic and religious freedom, the rule of law and respect for human life. We are more determined than ever to live our lives in freedom.” —Rudy Giuliani

We feel renewed devotion to the principles of political, economic and religious freedom, the rule of law and respect for human life. We are more determined than ever to live our lives in freedom.” —Rudy Giuliani

text: Friday, March 22nd is an early dismissal at 12:23 PM. Spring break will be March 25th – 29th. Parent teacher conferences are Thursday, April 4th and Friday, April 5th. Sophomores will have a Baked Potato Feed on Thursday, April 4th.

post_text:
The sophomore and junior social studies classes are preparing for their annual National History Day (NHD) school-level competition. The students are creating ten-minute historical documentaries based on the theme "Triumph and Tragedy in History.” This event will be held in the high school computer lab on Friday, March 15th, starting at 8:30 AM. The public is invited to attend. The top finishers in both the individual and group documentaries will move on to the state competition to be held in April. For more information, contact Mr. Kubishta or Mr. Simpson at 457-2175.

For a copy of the NHD Competition schedule, click on the link below.

https://core-docs.s3.amazonaws.com/documents/asset/uploaded_file/319369/NHD_Helix_Competition_2019.pdf

post_text: The 6th-12th grade students and staff helped celebrate Mrs. Baker's 95th birthday today. We are so blessed to have Mrs. Baker in our school and in our lives.

post_text: Looking for Crab Feed tickets? If so, we have a few extra that people have for sale. Call the Helix SD office for more info. 541-457-2175.

post_text:
Helix School Goes into Lock-Out

The Helix School District received a call from the Umatilla County Sheriff’s Dept. around 10:45AM, Tuesday, Feb. 19. The Sheriff’s Dept. asked for the District to go into Lock-Out mode while they dealt with a situation within the city limits of Helix. About 11:10AM the Sheriff’s Dept. called the school and advised the District that the situation was over and to return to normal.
text:
Helix School Goes into Lock-Out

The Helix School District received a call from the Umatilla County Sheriff’s Dept. around 10:45AM, Tuesday, Feb. 19. About 11:10AM the Sheriff’s Dept. called the school and advised the District that the situation was over and to return to normal.

post_text: Congratulations Helix High School FBLA on a terrific Blue Mt Region conference where 12 students earned 17 top ten finishes. — at Eastern Oregon University.

post_text: As you can see, the Helix School District now has it's own Facebook page. All information pertaining to the school will be posted here and not on the Helix Community page.
